metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7872 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The key_gc_unused_keys function in security/keys/gc.c in the Linux kernel through 4.2.6 allows local users to cause a denial of service (OOPS) via crafted keyctl commands. Dmitry Vyukov discovered that the Linux kernel's keyring handler attempted to garbage collect incompletely instantiated keys. A local unprivileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7872` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
